title: Bad luck has to run out eventually, right?
body:
Let me preface this by saying I know I need to improve my own game.

But I feel like every time I step into a ranked lobby, I've been matchmade with absolute muppets, and the other team has two or three people capable of carrying.

Currently my win rate in ranked is 9%. 2 wins from 22 matches. One of those wins was in a premade with a few people far more skilled than me. So from random lobbies I'm 1 from 21. 

Admittedly, I've played a lot of those 22 games as support, so my ability to carry is somewhat reliant on my ADC, and now I'm starting to play more ADC and toplane to try and impact the game more.

But seriously, this can't be normal. After my trial games I was placed in Bronze III, and I'm on a rapid slide to B5. 

This has to end at some point... right?

Crying big fat salty {{item:3070}}s

replies.body:
low elo supports: "muh adc muh adc waaaah"

you know you can influnce the map right?
supports are legit secondary junglers who work 2 jobs: babysit the adc until they're strong and roam and help others.

or dont play support and actually fix your winrate that way

rito matchmaking

You are ranked as low elo, given good team mates and pitched vs. worse opponents
"yay 10 game winning streak i am a god!"

A winning streak results in a high elo meaning you get shit team mates and pitched vs. better opponents
"i am so unlucky to keep getting muppet team mates and losing.

rince and repeat for infinity.

matching making is a rollercoaster.

Bad luck doesn't exist. It's sheer coincidence. No game has any connection with another except for your presence, to which you've already pointed out you can improve on the game which is totally in your hands and that is totally fine. However, the fact that you are playing support for a ton of these games is a major factor. Sometimes I'm in games that are going badly as support hoping I could've played a more carrying role than supporting role seeing the mistakes others make. I would say to try stop playing support unless your team absolutely needs you, and even then you need to ask yourself, are you really better at carrying or offensive roles rather than defensive.

I was sort of going for the more traditional definition of luck - "success or failure apparently brought by chance rather than through one's own actions". Insofar as the people I end up matched with is determined by chance, rather than my actions. Which it is.

Like yeah, I can improve. But I don't think I'm 91% loss rate bad.

I guess a more concise question would be is it possible to win games in bronze without being a solo carry?

>
> I was sort of going for the more traditional definition of luck - "success or failure apparently brought by chance rather than through one's own actions". Insofar as the people I end up matched with is determined by chance, rather than my actions. Which it is.
> 
> Like yeah, I can improve. But I don't think I'm 91% loss rate bad.
> 
> I guess a more concise question would be is it possible to win games in bronze without being a solo carry?

Well bad luck doesn't exist in terms of 'continuously getting bad teams' since there is no link between your games, unless you happen to get a couple of feeders in the same team continuously which, despite having a low chance, has happened before to me in the past

No one is bad enough for a 9% win rate, if you're around 40% to 30%, you're bad, if you're below 20% then something's wrong, and it's most likely a whole bundle of problems which coincidentally bunch up to result in a 9% win rate.

On literal terms, it's possible to win games in Bronze using anything really, but the answer you're probably looking for is, is that you're far better off playing a carry role if you're confident in yourself. Otherwise by playing support your team as a whole is wasting potential; your skill.
